description:
Google accountants are a savvy bunch who handle the core accounting responsibilities at Google. As a member of this team, you know your accounting principles and the full accounting process end to end. You'll advise on financial reports required by governmental regulations, and you'll review, analyze, and interpret financial and budgetary reports -- and all this sounds like fun to you. Every day is a new challenge, and you're continually looking for ways to help our team get better at what we do, in the most efficient way possible. A team player at heart, you collaborate with our global team, advocate best practices and roll up your sleeves to pitch in when it's all hands on deck. You move fast while keeping your attention to detail, and you tap into your problem-solving skills to support Google's business objectives.

Google Finance is about to embark on a significant process and systems transformation and is looking for a Project Accountant to keep project expenses and benefits on track. In this role, you'll work closely with Program Leads across Finance and Corporate Engineering to understand project objectives, timelines, risks and cost. You'll partner with Program Managers to build the annual budget for a wide range of projects, oversee and identify cost variances vs plan, work with program managers and FP&A to ensure the plan is aligned with any portfolio changes and keep our portfolio within budget. You will ensure project expenses are managed in line with US GAAP accounting principles.

The name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree in a business field or equivalent practical experience.
  • CPA or similar certification.
  • 6 yeas of relevant work experience. Financial management experience including budgeting, reporting and analysis.
  • Experience with U.S. GAAP accounting principles (software development costs, long lived assets, etc).

Preferred qualifications:

  • MBA degree.
  • Ability to work with senior management and influence decision making
  • Demonstrable ability to work independently, build strong relationships and effectively interact with others.
  • Demonstrated analytical skills combined with laser attention to detail and excellent problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-moving, dynamic and complex environment.
  • Effective oral and written communication skills.
responsibilities:
• Ensure financial controls are in place for every one of our core projects eg process and controls with respect to contracting, payments, accruals, and look for opportunities to simplify and streamline.
  • Be responsible for working with project leads to pull together the project budget, and manage budget for the period and cost to complete.
  • Ensure all expenditures are captured in accordance with accounting regulations and reported to finance business partners.
  • Work with teams to set the baseline metrics and monitoring benefits throughout and at the close of the project.
  • Understand and tightly control headcount expenses against budget for a very large team spanning Finance, Corporate Engineering and Systems Integrators
title: Senior Project Accountant, Alphabet Finance
